title: (x) Serif text face used in April 06 Wired magazine - H&FJ Mercury {Tiff}
content:
I found this body text in the 04.06 edition of Wired Mag. Can anyone help me identify the font? Thanks so much!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172815im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jenstype2.gif)

 [‹ (x) "Dinnertime" retro script - Quiggley Wiggly {Dennis, Ben}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172815/http:/typophile.com/node/18883 "Go to previous forum topic") [all caps monospaced electro-mechanical printer type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172815/http:/typophile.com/node/18733 "Go to next forum topic")
author: germanny

comments.content: Jen, would it be possible to upload a larger-magnification image of a smaller portion of the body text? I can’t quite tell at this resolution what shape the serifs are, which makes IDing it a bit more difficult.
In the olden days Wired always listed the fonts they were using in the back of the mag - maybe they still do.

I think Tiffany got it right. It’s hard to be sure with low-res scan, but judge for yourself with the test driver for H&FJ [Mercury Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172815/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/mercurytext/testdriver/index.html).
